III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4127 Staff to resident ratio.
Section (4) When residents are asleep or otherwise outside of the direct
Description supervision of staff, staff shall perform variable interval, eye-on
checks of residents. The time between the variable interval checks
shall not exceed fifteen minutes.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Between 5/21/25-5/22/25, a staff member did not perform
mandated 15-minute room checks on 6 youth at the facility. As a
result, a youth was able to sneak into another youth's room where
they engaged in sexual contact. Another youth distracted the staff
member so this could take place.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/2/2025. Administrator reported Staff 1 worked overnight shifts at
the facility for a couple years. Administrator reported staff were
feeling as though something was off at the facility as youth were
acting as they were up to something. Staff, unknown specifically
who, heard youth talking about something occurring and slowly
through piecing information together, Program Supervisor began
reviewing video footage and talked to youth and learned Staff 1
did not complete required room checks resulting in Youth A
sneaking into Youth B’s bedroom. Administrator reported upon
Program Supervisor reviewing more video footage, another night
was viewed where Staff 1 did not complete varying interval checks
on youth during the night at which time Staff 1 was fired from the
facility.
Program Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 6/2/2025. Program Manager reported she was notified
on 5/23/2025 from a floor staff about a Google document that had
been intercepted by a teacher in school. Program Supervisor
reported the document was unclear on what was being said as it
was coded and in “kid slang”. Program Supervisor reported she
pulled one of the youth aside who was writing back and forth with
Youth A and asked what the document said. Program Supervisor
reported she gathered enough information to figure out it was
related to a youth sneaking into another youth’s bedroom.
Program Supervisor reported she began to review video footage
and pieced information together when Youth A disclosed she had
sexual relations with a youth at the facility. Program Supervisor
reported video footage was reviewed after finding out the date.
Program Supervisor reported Staff 1 did not complete the required
checks on youth. Program Supervisor reported she went in on
2

5/27/2025 and met with Staff 1 and reviewed expectations on
completing room checks on youth. Program Supervisor reported
she completed a few of the checks that night while she was onsite
and left after speaking with Staff 1. Program Supervisor reported
the next morning she reviewed video footage of the night prior
(5/27/2025 into the morning of 5/28/2025) and found Staff 1 did
not completed any room checks on youth after she left the facility.
Program Supervisor reported from 12:20am to 6am there were no
checks completed on youth. Program Supervisor reported the
night of 5/21/2025 to 5/22/2025 (the night Youth A snuck into
Youth B’s bedroom) there was a timeframe of approximately five
hours where Staff 1 did not complete any bedroom checks on
youth.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/2/2025. Youth A reported she waited for the night staff, Staff 1,
to come into work as Youth A reported she thought it would be
more likely to sneak into Youth B’s bedroom when there was only
one night staff on shift. Youth A reported she had her roommate
go talk to Staff 1 to distract Staff 1 along with Youth B and Youth
C. Youth A reported her roommate gave her a hand signal which
indicated she was clear to go from her room and sneak into Youth
B’s bedroom while she was talking and distracting Staff 1. Youth
A reported she was in Youth B and Youth C’s bedroom for about
two hours. Youth A reported Youth C went out to talk to Staff 1
while she was in Youth B’s bedroom engaging in consensual
sexual activities with Youth B. Youth A reported Staff 1 never
completed a bedroom check while she was in Youth B’s bedroom
over the two-hour period. Youth A reported Youth B went out to
talk and distract Staff 1 while she snuck back to her bedroom.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was a regularly night staff. Youth A
reported she did not know if Staff 1 completed checks on youth
during the night as she typically is asleep. Youth A reported staff
typically check on youth every 15 minutes when youth are in their
bedroom. Youth A reported during the week youth go into their
bedrooms for bedtime at 9pm and on weekends it’s 10pm. Youth
A reported she planned to sneak into Youth B’s bedroom when
Staff 1 was working as Youth A reported she knew if Youth C went
out to talk to Staff 1 that she would be able to get away with being
in Youth B’s bedroom as Staff 1 “is a talker” and would be easily
distracted.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/2/2025. Youth C reported Youth A snuck into his and Youth B’s
bedroom however was unable to recall the day. Youth C reported
he, Youth B, and some other youth, unable to recall who, were
3

talking to Staff 1 outside the office door when Youth A snuck from
her bedroom into his and Youth B’s bedroom. Youth C reported
he and Youth B went back to their bedroom and Youth A was
hiding in the bathroom. Youth C reported he went back out and
talked to Staff 1 for about an hour and a half while Youth A and
Youth B were in the bedroom. Youth C reported Staff 1 never
completed any checks on any youth during this time. Youth C
reported staff typically check on youth when youth are in their
bedrooms for the night every fifteen to thirty minutes by shining a
flashlight into the youth bedrooms. Youth C reported this was the
first time since he has been at the facility that youth have snuck
into one another’s bedrooms that he was aware of.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/2/2025. Youth D reported he talked to Staff 1 the other night
from 10-11pm. Youth D reported during the hour he spoke with
Staff 1, Staff 1 did not complete any bedroom checks on youth at
the facility. Youth D reported Staff 1 typically would check on
youth at night every hour. Youth D reported he was not aware of
any youth sneaking into other youth’s bedrooms at night.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/10/2025. Staff 1
reported the facility’s policy is to complete room checks on youth
every fifteen minutes while youth are in their bedrooms for
nighttime. Staff 1 reported when completing checks, the facility’s
expectation is for staff to make sure the youth are in their beds.
Staff 1 reported he worked on 5/21/2025 into the morning of
5/22/2025 when Youth A and Youth B had sexual intercourse in
Youth B’s bedroom. Staff 1 reported Youth C came out and talked
to him and distracted him. Staff 1 reported he did not complete
the required room checks per the facility’s policy and took full
responsibility for it. Staff 1 reported when he worked night shift
there were “occasions” he did not complete room checks as
required as he felt it would wake the youth up as well as he did not
feel comfortable entering the female youth’s bedrooms to check
on them as he was a male.
Youth B was interviewed via telephone on 6/11/2025. Youth B
reported while he was placed at the facility, Youth A snuck into his
bedroom one night. Youth B reported Youth A was in his
bedroom approximately thirty minutes. Youth B reported during
the time Youth A was in his bedroom, no staff completed any
bedroom checks on him. Youth B reported he did not recall
specifically which staff was on shift however reported Staff 1
worked Sunday through Thursday on the overnight shift. Youth B
reported per the facility’s handbook; staff are supposed to
4

complete bedroom checks on youth every fifteen minutes however
this does not happen as Staff 1 typically checked on youth every
twenty to twenty-five minutes.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the unit main living area showing the
bedroom doors on 5/21/2025-5/22/2025 was reviewed on
6/2/2025. Per video footage Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D can
be viewed outside the staff office door at 10:55pm. Youth A exited
her bedroom and entered Youth B’s bedroom at 10:57pm. Youth
B, Youth C, and Youth D go back into their bedrooms at 10:59pm.
At 11:21pm Staff 1 walked over to the bedroom door and Youth C
exited his and Youth B’s bedroom and followed Staff 1 to the
office. Youth C sat in the office with Staff 1. At 11:23pm Youth B
exited his bedroom and walked to the office and then back to his
bedroom. At 12:31am Youth B exited his bedroom, turned off the
light in the living room, went into the staff office with Staff 1 and
Youth C and sat in front of the window. Youth A exited Youth B’s
bedroom at 12:32am and crawled back into her bedroom. Youth
B and Youth C exited the unit with Staff 1 at 12:37am and return
at 12:38am and went back into their bedroom. Staff 1 turned the
living room light back on and entered the staff office. Staff 1 sat in
the staff office and did not complete any checks on the youth
throughout the night. Staff 1 returned notebooks to the youth’s
bedrooms at 6:24am however does not appear to check on the
youth as he just opened the youth bedroom doors and placed the
notebooks inside the door.
Video footage of the unit main living area showing the
bedroom doors on 5/27/2025-5/28/2025 was reviewed on
6/2/2025. Program Supervisor completed bedroom check on
youth at 11:09pm, 11:21pm, and 11:40pm. Staff 1 completed a
check on the youth at 11:53pm. At 12:49am Staff 1 shines the
flashlight into the bedrooms, however, does not appear to look in
the bedrooms. At 6:21am Staff 1 returns notebooks to the youth’s
bedrooms and sets the notebook inside the door, and 6:29am
Staff 1 begins waking up the youth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Great Lakes Recovery Center for Youth Bedtime: Staff will
begin nighttime checks to make sure clients are
appropriately dressed. Starting at 10pm, staff will complete
15-minute nightly checks. Staff should ensure they see a
body part to confirm that the clients is present and is
breathing and not in any distress. The status of the client
5

(i.e. sleeping, tossing/turning, etc.) must be documented on
the night shift log that is to be placed in the daybook upon
completion of shift.
• Incident Draft Form for Great Lakes Recovery Centers
dated 6/2/2025 for Youth A, Youth B, and Staff 1: Upon
review of the camera footage on 5/21/2025 showed staff
not conducting the CCI licensing 15-minute room checks on
clients. Staff 1 did not complete checks on youth for over
an hour. Upon further review of video footage, on
5/28/2025 during review a lack of 15-minute checks was
observed again even though documentation shows a
completion of checks. It appears Staff 1 only completed
three or four checks all night.
• Lake Superior Wing Night Shift Checks 5/21/2025-
5/22/2025: Checks began at 11:01pm through 7:01am.
Staff 1 documented he completed all the checks.
• GLRC ASC Overnight Sleep Log dated 5/27/2025-
5/28/2025: Check times began at 11:10pm through 6:59am.
Checks were completed by Program Supervisor at
11:10pm, 11:25pm, and 11:42pm. Staff 1 documented he
completed and documented all room checks from 11:55pm
through 6:59am.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had two discipline records,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 received training on
varying interval room checks on 1/16/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as per interviews with
youth, Administrator, Program Supervisor, and Staff 1 and video
review, varying interval checks not to exceed fifteen minutes were
not completed overnight from 5/21/2025 to 5/22/2025 and
5/27/2025 to 5/28/2025.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
• The facility update their internal policy to align with CCI
Rule 400.4127(4).
• The facility retrain staff on the updated facility policy.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & PA 116 722.120 Investigation, inspection, and examination of
Section conditions, books, records, and reports; access by
Description department, bureau of fire services, or local authorities;
records; report; forms; confidentiality; disclosure of
6

information; availability of confidential records; child
information cards to be provided to department; failure of
licensee to cooperate with investigation, inspection, or
examination.
(1) The department may investigate, inspect, and examine
conditions of a childcare organization and may investigate and
examine the books and records of the licensee. The licensee shall
cooperate with the department's investigation, inspection, and
examination by doing all of the following:
(c) Providing accurate and truthful information to the department,
and encouraging witnesses, such as staff and household
members, to provide accurate and truthful information to the
department.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The facility falsified varying interview check logs as the check logs
completed by Staff 1 indicated checks occurred however per video
footage no checks occurred on the times Staff 1 documented he
completed room checks on youth.
Investigation Interviews:
Administrator was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
6/2/2025. Administrator reported Staff 1 completed check log
forms with times entered that he checked on youth however per
video footage review Staff 1 did not complete checks he had
documented on the room check log.
Program Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on 6/2/2025. Program Supervisor reported Staff 1
documented he had completed checks on youth on the room
check form however per video footage review, Staff 1 did not
complete the checks he had documented on the room check log.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/10/2025. Staff 1
reported he did not complete the checks that he indicated on the
room check log. Staff 1 reported he documented he completed the
checks in order to comply with the facility’s policy.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of the unit main living area showing the
bedroom doors on 5/21/2025-5/22/2025 was reviewed on
6/2/2025. Per video footage review, Staff 1 did not complete any
room checks on the youth in the facility from 10:55pm through
6:24am when Staff 1 returned the notebooks into the youth’s
bedrooms, however Staff 1 does not appear to check on the youth
as he just opened the youth bedroom doors and placed the
journals inside the door.
7

Video footage of the unit main living area showing the
bedroom doors on 5/27/2025-5/28/2025 was reviewed on
6/2/2025. Program Supervisor completed bedroom check on
youth at 11:09pm, 11:21pm, and 11:40pm. Staff 1 completed a
check on the youth at 11:53pm. At 12:49am Staff 1 shines the
flashlight into the bedrooms however does not appear to look in
the bedrooms. At 6:21am Staff 1 returns notebooks to the youth’s
bedrooms and sets the notebook inside the door. At 6:29am Staff
1 begins waking up the youth. No checks were completed per
video footage reviewed from 12:49am through 6:21am.
Documents Reviewed:
• Corporate Compliance Program: Great Lakes Recovery
Center’s leadership is fully committed to the prevention and
detection of fraud, fiscal mismanagement, and
misappropriation of funds and, therefore, to the development
of a formal Corporate Compliance Program to ensure
ongoing monitoring and compliance with all legal, ethical,
and regulatory requirements. Fraud: Intentional deception or
misrepresentation made by a person with the knowledge that
such deception could result in some benefit to
himself/herself or another person. Knowingly: A person (1)
has actual knowledge of false information on the claim, (2)
acts in deliberate ignorance of the truth or falsity of the
information, (3) acts in reckless disregard of the truth to
falsity of the information, and no proof of specific intent to
defraud is required.
• Incident Draft Form for Great Lakes Recovery Centers
dated 6/2/2025 for Youth A, Youth B, and Staff 1: Upon
further review of video footage, on 5/28/2025 during review
a lack of 15-minute checks was observed again even
though documentation shows a completion of checks. It
appears Staff 1 only completed three or four checks all
night.
• Lake Superior Wing Night Shift Checks 5/21/2025-
5/22/2025: Checks began at 11:01pm through 7:01am.
Staff 1 documented he completed all the checks.
• GLRC ASC Overnight Sleep Log dated 5/27/2025-
5/28/2025: Check times began at 11:10pm through 6:59am.
Checks were completed by Program Supervisor at
11:10pm, 11:25pm, and 11:42pm. Staff 1 documented
various times he reportedly completed room checks from
11:55pm through 6:59am.
8

• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had two discipline records,
unrelated to this investigation. Staff 1 received training on
varying interval room checks on 1/16/2024.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 falsified times on
the room check log indicating he had completed room checks on
the youth however per video footage review, Staff 1 did not
complete the room checks he documented for overnights
5/21/2025 to 5/22/2025 and 5/27/2025 to 5/28/2025.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
